results.title: A Portrait of the artist as a young man
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Ulysses Film Production
results.brief_description: This magnificent adaption of James Joyce’s autobiographical novel is a faithful portrait of the young author and his coming-of-age. It portrays Stephen Dedalus and his Irish Catholic upbringing, his confrontation with the tyranny of the Church and his sexual guilt and frustration which start him on the path of rebellion. The young artist chooses lonely exile in his search for freedom and truth. Starring Bosco Hogan, T.P. McKenna and John Gielgud.

results.title: Ulysses
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick, Continental and Walter Reade
results.brief_description: Portrays a stream-of-consciousness in a day in the life of Leopold Bloom, Molly Bloom and Stephen Dedalus (the hero of Joyce’s earlier biographical novel, “A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man”). Bloom is an ordinary man; a Jew whose odyssey through the streets of turn-of-the-century Dublin leads him through trails that parallel his classic prototype, Ulysses on his epic journey home. Molly is his voluptuous, delightfully earthy wife whose infidelity is a major burden to Bloom. The intimacy of Joyce’s language was without precedent in literature, and its flashbacks, dream episodes, sounds and visual montages translate freely into the language of cinema. Starring Milo O’Shea and Barbara Jefford.

results.title: The Phantom of liberty = La Fantome de la liberte
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Films
results.brief_description: This is Bunuel’s very personal version of La Ronde, and in eight sketches - each representing a different aspect of hypocrisy - he creates a succession of dazzling moments. The sketches use every type of comedy: there is a interval of French farce with slamming bedroom doors, two trenchantly black jokes about cancer and mass murder and a piece of pure lunesco. Each sketch has its point to make and its own authority figures to be lampooned. This is a delightful and hilarious Bunuelian masterpiece. French dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dead
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Chris Sievernich, Wieland Schulz-Keil, Channel Four, Delta Films, Liffey Films, Vestron Pictures and Zenith
results.brief_description: It is January 6, 1904, on a snowy night in Dublin; a festive night at the Morkan house, as Miss Kate, Miss Julia and their niece Mary Jane prepare for their annual party. In this his last film, John Huston, captures the wonderful mix of comedy and quiet tragedy portrayed in James Joyce’s short stroy from “The Dubliners”. As the evening progresses, the characters subtly betray their secret lives, culminating in the moment when Gabriel, the calm observer, learns a secret that will change his life forever. A beautiful, eloquent film.

results.title: Smash palace
results.creator_credit: Roger Donaldson, Aardvark Films and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: Smash Palace is a remarkable drama about a marital breakup which erupts into an impulsive kidnapping of a child by the father, and a totally credible escalation to the brink of tragedy. Bruno Lawrence and Anna Jemison play the estranged couple in strong performances. Filmed amongst a vast junk-yard of cars, Donaldson’s direction is economical and enthralling, capturing the tension that goes beneath the surface of this all too real drama.

results.title: Patrick
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Antony Ginnane, Australian International Film Corporation and IFM Films
results.brief_description: Patrick, having murdered his mother and her lover, has become a polyplegic, pre-oedipal, psychotic lump. He has telekinetic powers, fancies his nurse and is hostile to his doctor. This is an entertaining mix of black humour and suspense with a few shocks. Cast includes Susan Penhaligon, Robert Helpmann and Rod Mullinar.

results.title: The Best of friends
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Tom Jeffrey, Friendly Film Productions and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Angela Punch McGregor and Graeme Blundell star as two old school friends who have known one another since childhood, and have shared personal triumphs and crises. Overnight, their relationship dramatically changes from friends to lovers. A once beautiful relationship is threatened, and the complication of an unexpected pregnancy throws them both into a spin! A light romantic comedy with a strong supporting cast including Ruth Cracknell, Henri Szeps and Mark Lee.

results.title: The Perfectionist
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.brief_description: Stuart Gunn (John Waters) is a perfectionist. Barbara (Jacki Weaver) is his long suffering wife. Stuart and Barbara reach a crossroads in their relationship when she wishes to return to the workforce whilst he wants her to stay at home. Finally, Barbara wins out and a babysitter is hired, though not the usual stereotype. He is a tall, blond and handsome Scandinavian called Erik. Without warning the roles of Stuart and Barbara have been reversed - but who is the better off? Starring Jacki Weaver, John Waters, Noel Ferrier and Steven Vidler. Screenplay by David Williamson from his stageplay.

results.title: Jane Austen in Manhattan
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, Merchant Ivory Productions and Polytel Films
results.brief_description: Anne Baxter, in one of her greatest performances, plays the elegant Lilianna, an actress and drama coach, struggling to produce a newly discovered Jane Austen play. However, the manuscript is in the hands of Pierre (Robert Powell), an ex-student of Lilianna’s, who has broken away from traditional theatre values into bizzare experimental techniques and a raging tug-of-war ensues between the traditional and experimental. Co-starring Michael Wager, Tim Choate, Sean Young, John Guerrasio, Katrina Hodiak, Kurt Johnson, Philip Lenkowsky, Nancy New and Charles McCaughan. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala and based upon Sir Charles Grandison or “The Happy Man”.

results.title: In country
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Richard Roth and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: At seventeen, Samantha Hughes of Hopewell, Kentucky is pretty, energetic, headstrong and curious; curious about the father she never knew, and curious about the war that took him away - the war nobody wants to remember. Bruce Willis plays a reclusive vet in this story of a family’s struggle to heal the wounds of Vietnam. This film captures both the horror of battle and the disillusionment of a young soldier who thought war meant glory. Norman Jewison directs this heartfelt and powerful movie highlighted by one of the most poignant final scenes ever filmed - the family’s emotionally stirring, almost wordless visit to the Vietnam Veteran’s Memorial in Washington D.C. “In country” is the term American GI’s used for their time in Vietnam. Based on the novel by Bobbie Ann Mason.
